summary: Remove the broken Worker suspend and resume polling methods from the TypeScript SDK. Core has moved WFT polling to background execution, making the current suspend/resume implementation incompatible. These methods should be disabled for now until properly reimplemented.
userImpact: Users relying on suspend and resume methods for Worker control will have these features removed until properly reimplemented.
rootCause: Core changed WFT polling to run in the background regardless of language-level polling requests, which breaks the suspend/resume implementation.
proposedFix: Disable suspend and resume methods for now; reimplement properly in core at a later time.
resolutionDetails: Feature was removed as part of the TypeScript SDK update to align with Core's background WFT polling approach.
keyQuote: Since implemented we've decided to change WFT polling in Core to run in the background regardless of lang polling requests.
